DEVELOPING A STRATEGY TO OBTAIN OBSERVER STATUS FOR TAIWAN IN THE INTERNATIONAL CRIMINAL POLICE ORGANIZATION

extension.searchTitle: DEVELOPING A STRATEGY TO OBTAIN OBSERVER STATUS FOR TAIWAN IN THE INTERNATIONAL CRIMINAL POLICE ORGANIZATION; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 40

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Directing the Secretary of State to develop a strategy to obtain observer status for Taiwan in the International Criminal Police Organization
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>S. 2426, to direct the Secretary of State to develop a strategy to obtain observer status for Taiwan in the International Criminal Police Organization, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 381 yeas with none voting ``nay'', Roll No. 111; and

titleInfo.title: DEFINING CERTAIN ATROCITIES AS WAR CRIMES, CRIMES AGAINST HUMANITY, AND GENOCIDE

extension.searchTitle: DEFINING CERTAIN ATROCITIES AS WAR CRIMES, CRIMES AGAINST HUMANITY, AND GENOCIDE; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 40

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the concurrent resolution, as amended, was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Expressing the sense of Congress that those who commit or support atrocities against Christians and other ethnic and religious minorities, including Yezidis, Turkmen, Sabea-Mandeans, Kaka`e, and Kurds, and who target them specifically for ethnic or religious reasons, are committing, and are hereby declared to be committing ``war crimes'', ``crimes against humanity'', and ``genocide''
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H. Con. Res. 75, amended, expressing the sense of Congress that those who commit or support atrocities against Christians and other ethnic and religious minorities, including Yezidis, Turkmen, Sabea-Mandeans, Kaka`e, and Kurds, and who target them specifically for ethnic or religious reasons, are committing, and are hereby declared to be committing ``war crimes'', ``crimes against humanity'', and ``genocide'', by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 393 yeas with none voting ``nay'', Roll No. 112;

titleInfo.title: United States House Concurrent Resolution 75 (114th Congress)
United States House Concurrent Resolution 75 (114th Congress)
CONDEMNING VIOLATIONS OF INTERNATIONAL LAW BY THE GOVERNMENT OF SYRIA

extension.searchTitle: CONDEMNING VIOLATIONS OF INTERNATIONAL LAW BY THE GOVERNMENT OF SYRIA; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 40

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the concurrent resolution, as amended, was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Expressing the sense of the Congress condemning the gross violations of international law amounting to war crimes and crimes against humanity by the Government of Syria, its allies, and other parties to the conflict in Syria, and asking the President to direct his Ambassador at the United Nations to promote the establishment of a war crimes tribunal where these crimes could be addressed
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H. Con. Res. 121, amended, expressing the sense of the Congress condemning the gross violations of international law amounting to war crimes and crimes against humanity by the Government of Syria, its allies, and other parties to the conflict in Syria, and asking the President to direct his Ambassador at the United Nations to promote the establishment of a war crimes tribunal where these crimes could be addressed, by a 2/3 yea-and-nay vote of 393 yeas to 3 nays, Roll No. 113;
